attributes.comment:
1) With all the talk against "illegal" immigrants, it is outrageous to punish
immigrants who have followed the legal route by changing the rules in midstream,
making their citizenship application costs prohibitive, and letting the
immigration service shift the burden of its own inefficiency onto the backs of
those who suffer most from that inefficiency.

2) This regulation change appears to be a blatant attempt by the Administration
to discourage qualified prospects for citizenship from applying, since the
Republican Party fears that that new citizens might vote against them. In this
sense, the fee increase is the equivalent of an illegal poll tax.

3) Insofar as legal immigrants pay taxes but cannot vote, they are essentially
victims of taxation without representation.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Ruth Henderson
